title: [xSDK] pflotran fails to build on NERSC Cori
body:
I am trying to install xSDK on NERSC Cori. I have previously not had issues with pflotran in the installation process, but suddenly I am getting an error:

`cray-libsci/18.07.1 is not available for the Intel compiler` 
The same error occurs when @mamelara tries to install using gcc.

I haven't changed anything in my packages.yaml or compilers.yaml files since the last successful installation (I uninstalled it and was trying to reinstall to a new location).
Mario didn't change the packages.yaml file at all for the xSDK installation.

I tried install with the command `spack install -j8 --dirty xsdk`
Mario was trying with `spack install xsdk%gcc@7.3.0`

Modules
```commandline
Currently Loaded Modulefiles:
  1) modules/3.2.10.6                                 11) gni-headers/5.0.12.0-6.0.7.0_24.1__g3b1768f.ari
  2) nsg/1.2.0                                        12) xpmem/2.2.15-6.0.7.1_5.11__g7549d06.ari
  3) intel/18.0.1.163                                 13) job/2.2.3-6.0.7.0_44.1__g6c4e934.ari
  4) craype-network-aries                             14) dvs/2.7_2.2.117-6.0.7.1_9.2__gf817677
  5) craype/2.5.15                                    15) alps/6.6.43-6.0.7.0_26.4__ga796da3.ari
  6) cray-libsci/18.07.1                              16) rca/2.2.18-6.0.7.0_33.3__g2aa4f39.ari
  7) udreg/2.3.2-6.0.7.0_33.18__g5196236.ari          17) atp/2.1.3
  8) ugni/6.0.14.0-6.0.7.0_23.1__gea11d3d.ari         18) PrgEnv-intel/6.0.4
  9) pmi/5.0.14                                       19) craype-haswell
 10) dmapp/7.1.1-6.0.7.0_34.3__g5a674e0.ari           20) cray-mpich/7.7.3
```

packages.yaml
```
packages:
  mpich:
    modules:
      mpich@7.7.3: cray-mpich
    buildable: False
  intel-mkl:
    paths:
      intel-mkl@18.0.2.199: /opt/intel
    buildable: False
  autoconf:
    paths:
      autoconf@2.69: /usr
    buildable: False
  automake:
    paths:
      automake@1.13.4: /usr
    buildable: False
  libtool:
    paths:
      libtool@2.4.2: /usr
    buildable: False
  cmake:
    modules:
      cmake: cmake/3.5.2
    buildable: False
  all:
    providers:
      mpi: [mpich]
      blas: [intel-mkl]
      lapack: [intel-mkl]
    compiler: [intel@18.0.1.163]
```
